description: A small, confident terrier-like companion with a monkey-like face and spirited personality.
health_considerations: Generally sturdy but can suffer from patellar luxation and dental issues due to small jaws. Regular dental care and monitoring for joint problems are important.
key_health_tips: Brush teeth several times per week to avoid periodontal disease. Monitor for signs of knee instability and keep a healthy weight to reduce joint stress.

description: An elegant, long-coated sighthound known for its regal appearance and independent nature.

physical_traits.tail: Long, with a distinctive ring at the end

health_considerations: Prone to hip dysplasia, hypothyroidism and sensitivity to anesthesia. Their long coat requires regular grooming to prevent matting.
key_health_tips: Provide regular grooming and coat maintenance to avoid mats. Exercise safely — Afghans are sighthounds and should be exercised in secure areas due to strong chase drive.

description: Also known as the African wild dog, a lean, highly social, and stamina-rich hunter native to sub-Saharan Africa.
health_considerations: A wild species rather than a domestic breed; susceptible to infectious diseases when in contact with domestic dogs and sensitive to habitat changes. Not suited to typical pet environments.
key_health_tips: Not a suitable companion for domestic life; conservation and disease prevention in wild populations are priorities. Avoid contact with domestic dogs to prevent disease transmission.

description: The largest of the terriers — versatile, intelligent and bold with a wiry coat and dignified air.
health_considerations: Can experience hip dysplasia and skin allergies; ear infections are possible if ears are not kept clean. Tendencies toward weight gain if under-exercised.
key_health_tips: Provide vigorous daily exercise and mental stimulation. Maintain regular grooming (hand-stripping or clipping) to preserve coat texture and check ears weekly.

description: A muscular, loyal dog known for courage, affectionate behavior with family, and strong working drive.

physical_traits.ears: Set high, typically cropped or natural

health_considerations: May be prone to hip dysplasia, cardiac issues, and skin allergies. Responsible breeding has reduced some genetic issues but periodic checks are recommended.
key_health_tips: Require consistent socialization and training from an early age. Maintain a lean body condition to reduce joint stress and have cardiac screening as recommended by vets.

description: A versatile Swiss farm dog: alert, strong, and agile with a tricolor coat and high endurance.
health_considerations: Generally healthy but can suffer from hip dysplasia and elbow issues. Their active nature means they can develop behavioral problems if bored.
key_health_tips: Provide daily, vigorous exercise and tasks to channel energy. Regular hip evaluations and consistent training/socialization are important.

description: A hardy, spirited terrier developed as an all-purpose farm and ratter dog in Australia.
health_considerations: Can experience patellar luxation and allergies; dental care is important for small breeds. Some lines show sensitivity to anesthesia.
key_health_tips: Provide daily walks and interactive play; maintain dental hygiene with regular brushing. Keep weight monitored to avoid joint strain.

description: A sleek, barkless hunting dog from central Africa known for its curious personality and catlike grooming habits.
health_considerations: Susceptible to Fanconi syndrome, hip dysplasia and progressive retinal atrophy in some lines. Their independence can complicate training.
key_health_tips: Test breeding stock for inherited conditions (e.g., Fanconi syndrome). Use reward-based training and provide safe, secure areas for exercise due to prey drive.

description: A low-slung scent hound with long ears and a relaxed, easygoing temperament — excellent nose and patient nature.
health_considerations: Prone to obesity, intervertebral disc disease and ear infections due to long, pendulous ears. Their heavy bone and body puts pressure on the spine and joints.
key_health_tips: Prevent obesity with measured feeding and regular exercise to reduce back stress. Clean ears weekly to prevent infections and avoid strenuous stair/climbing activity.

description: A compact scent hound prized for friendly nature, remarkable nose and suitability as a family dog.
health_considerations: Common issues include ear infections, obesity and hip dysplasia in some lines. Strong scent drive can make them wander off if not supervised.
key_health_tips: Secure yard or leash walks required due to strong nose/escape tendency. Clean ears regularly and control diet to avoid obesity.

description: A distinctively shaped terrier with a lamb-like coat, lively temperament and history as a hunter of vermin.
health_considerations: Some lines are prone to copper toxicosis (a liver condition) and patellar luxation. Regular liver function monitoring is advised in affected lines.
key_health_tips: If acquiring a Bedlington, ask for genetic testing for copper storage disease. Provide consistent exercise and grooming to maintain the unique coat.

description: A striking, tri-colored Swiss farm dog: strong, calm and exceptionally good with families.
health_considerations: Short lifespan relative to many breeds; high incidence of cancer, hip dysplasia and bloat. Regular screening and careful weight management are important.
key_health_tips: Avoid overfeeding — maintain lean condition to reduce joint strain. Discuss cancer screening and orthopedic checks with a veterinarian frequently.

description: Also known as the Blenheim type of Cavalier — affectionate, gentle and well-suited as a companion dog.
health_considerations: Prone to mitral valve disease, syringomyelia in some lines, and eye conditions. Responsible breeders screen for hereditary issues.
key_health_tips: Choose breeders who screen for heart and neurological conditions. Maintain regular vet check-ups for cardiac and ocular health.

description: A legendary scent hound with an extraordinary tracking nose, loose skin and gentle demeanor.
health_considerations: Prone to ear infections (long ears), bloat (gastric dilatation-volvulus), and hip dysplasia. Loose facial skin can trap moisture and bacteria.
key_health_tips: Feed smaller, frequent meals and avoid vigorous activity around mealtimes to lower bloat risk. Clean and inspect ears weekly and manage weight carefully.

description: A vocal scent hound with a distinct blue-mottled coat pattern, bred for tracking and treeing game.
health_considerations: Ear infections and obesity are common concerns; hip dysplasia can occur. Their strong scent drive may make them roam if off leash.
key_health_tips: Ensure secure fencing and leash control due to tracking instincts. Clean ears regularly and maintain an active lifestyle to prevent weight gain.

description: A highly intelligent and energetic herding dog prized for intense focus, responsiveness and athleticism.
health_considerations: Prone to hip dysplasia, epilepsy and certain eye conditions (e.g., Collie eye anomaly). Their high energy can lead to behavioral issues if not mentally stimulated.
key_health_tips: Provide daily intense physical and mental exercise (herding, agility, puzzle toys). Screen breeding stock for genetic eye issues and epilepsy where recommended.

description: A sturdy, affectionate terrier with a weatherproof coat and lively hunting heritage from the English-Scottish borders.
health_considerations: Occasional allergies and hip issues; generally robust. Dental care and ear checks are routine needs for small terriers.
key_health_tips: Keep active with daily walks and play. Routine grooming and dental care will reduce common small-breed issues.

description: A graceful Russian sighthound with a silky coat and calm, dignified temperament, bred to hunt by sight and speed.

physical_traits.coat: Long, silky and flat or wavy

health_considerations: Sighthound physiology makes them sensitive to some medications/anesthesia; hip dysplasia and cardiac issues can occur. Their thin body makes them temperature-sensitive.
key_health_tips: Use sighthound-safe anesthesia protocols when needed and monitor weight to avoid bony injuries. Exercise in secure areas to satisfy chase instincts.

description: A compact, friendly companion with a tuxedo-like coat and an adaptable, outgoing personality.
health_considerations: Brachycephalic features can cause breathing issues and heat sensitivity; eye injuries and patellar luxation also occur. Overheating is a major risk.
key_health_tips: Avoid intense exercise in heat and provide cool, ventilated environments. Monitor for respiratory distress and get regular eye checks.

description: A powerful, rugged farm and herding dog with a coarse double coat and calm, steady temperament.

physical_traits.tail: Traditionally docked; otherwise heavy and set low

health_considerations: Prone to hip dysplasia, bloat and some hereditary eye diseases. Their heavy coat requires routine grooming to avoid mats and skin problems.
key_health_tips: Schedule regular grooming and coat trimming. Maintain lean body condition to reduce bloat risk and perform periodic orthopedic screening.

description: A strong, playful and loyal dog known for exuberant personality and devotion to family.
health_considerations: Prone to cardiomyopathy, certain cancers, hip dysplasia and brachycephalic-related breathing problems. Puppies are energetic and need socialization.
key_health_tips: Monitor cardiac health with regular veterinary screenings. Keep them cool during hot weather due to short muzzles and provide consistent exercise.

description: A small, expressive toy breed with a rough face and lively, affectionate temperament — often seen as a charming companion.

physical_traits.coat: Rough and wiry on face; shorter on body

health_considerations: Brachycephalic features can predispose to breathing issues; dental crowding and eye problems may occur. Small size makes dental care important.
key_health_tips: Provide dental hygiene and avoid overheating; maintain routine veterinary dental and ophthalmologic checks. Socialize early to reduce small-dog anxiety.

description: A French herding dog with a long, wavy coat, known for intelligence, loyalty and protective instincts.

physical_traits.ears: Set high, natural or cropped, covered in hair

health_considerations: Can experience hip dysplasia, progressive retinal atrophy, and bloat. Heavy coat requires regular grooming to prevent mats and skin conditions.
key_health_tips: Provide daily exercise and mental tasks; commit to frequent grooming to manage coat. Discuss orthopedic screening for breeding stock.

description: An agile, versatile pointing dog with boundless energy and a friendly disposition — excellent in field work and as a family pet.

physical_traits.coat: Dense, flat or wavy with feathering

health_considerations: Occasional hip dysplasia and ear infections; epilepsy occurs in some lines. Needs plenty of exercise to prevent behavioral problems.
key_health_tips: Provide daily vigorous exercise and training. Keep ears clean and dry and maintain regular vet checkups for joint and neurological health.

description: A massive, powerful guardian dog that is calm, courageous and devoted to its family.
health_considerations: Prone to hip/elbow dysplasia, bloat, and certain cancers. Their large size shortens average lifespan compared with smaller breeds.
key_health_tips: Avoid overfeeding and keep activity controlled to reduce bloat risk. Schedule orthopedic and cardiac screenings and provide joint-supportive nutrition if advised.

description: A sturdy, small terrier with a weather-resistant coat and lively, fearless personality originally used for vermin control.
health_considerations: May develop hip dysplasia, eye disorders and skin allergies. Their small size can make dental hygiene a focus.
key_health_tips: Provide daily exercise and mental stimulation. Keep up with grooming and dental care to avoid common small-breed issues.

description: A sturdy, long-bodied herding dog with a loyal nature and large, expressive ears.
health_considerations: Prone to intervertebral disc disease due to long back, as well as hip dysplasia and obesity. Back-supporting management is critical.
key_health_tips: Limit jumping and stair strain, maintain lean body weight and provide core-strengthening exercise. Monitor for back pain and seek early veterinary care.

description: A rugged, water-loving retriever prized for its bravery, endurance and dense, oily coat suited to cold water work.
health_considerations: Can suffer from hip dysplasia, progressive retinal atrophy and hypothyroidism. Their oily coat can hide skin problems if not checked regularly.
key_health_tips: Rinse and dry coat after heavy water work to avoid skin irritation. Schedule routine eye and thyroid checks and provide daily exercise to maintain condition.

description: A tiny, alert toy dog with a big personality, prized for companionship and portability.
health_considerations: Susceptible to dental disease, luxating patella and hypoglycemia in puppies. Small size makes them vulnerable to injury from rough handling.
key_health_tips: Practice careful handling and use harnesses rather than collars to protect the trachea. Maintain dental hygiene and monitor puppy blood sugar during early months.

description: A dignified, lion-like dog with a dense double coat and independent temperament, known for its blue-black tongue.
health_considerations: Prone to hip dysplasia, entropion and autoimmune conditions. Heat intolerance due to heavy coat and dense build is a concern.
key_health_tips: Avoid hot climates and provide air-conditioned rest in summer. Regular grooming to remove dead undercoat reduces skin issues; screen hips for dysplasia.

description: A heavy-built spaniel with a calm, gentle nature and a dense, weatherproof coat suited to upland work.
health_considerations: Prone to obesity, ear infections and orthopedic issues including hip dysplasia. Their heavy bone and slow pace mean weight management is especially important.
key_health_tips: Monitor calorie intake and provide moderate exercise to avoid obesity. Clean ears regularly and schedule orthopedic checks if mobility declines.

description: A popular, affectionate sporting dog with expressive eyes, a silky coat and eager-to-please temperament.
health_considerations: Common issues include ear infections, progressive retinal atrophy, and skin allergies. Their long ears and dense coat can hide infections.
key_health_tips: Keep ears dry and clean; groom regularly to prevent matting. Monitor eyes and skin for signs of irritation and consult your vet for hereditary screening if breeding.

description: A graceful herding dog celebrated for intelligence, loyalty and classic long coat (Rough Collie) or short coat (Smooth Collie).
health_considerations: Prone to Collie eye anomaly, progressive retinal atrophy, and drug sensitivity (MDR1 gene in some lines). Thyroid issues can occur.
key_health_tips: Genetic testing (MDR1, eye conditions) is recommended for breeding. Provide mental stimulation and gentle grooming to keep coat and skin healthy.

description: A distinctive small terrier with a long body, topknot of hair and affectionate, tenacious character.
health_considerations: Prone to back problems and ocular issues; some lines may develop respiratory or heart concerns. As a small-breed terrier, dental care is necessary.
key_health_tips: Avoid excessive jumping and monitor for spinal discomfort. Maintain dental care and regular ophthalmologic checks when advised.

description: A wild Asiatic canid (also called the Asian wild dog) — highly social, endurance-oriented and adapted to varied terrain.
health_considerations: A wild species rather than a domestic breed; vulnerable to habitat loss and disease. Not appropriate for domestication as a pet.
key_health_tips: Support conservation efforts rather than attempting to keep as companion animals. Prevent disease spread between wild and domestic canids.

description: A wild dog of Australia with a lean, athletic build and highly adaptable hunting behavior.
health_considerations: Wild species subject to environmental pressures and disease; not a domestic companion breed. Conservation and management are primary concerns.
key_health_tips: Not suitable as a household pet; conservation strategies and minimizing human-wildlife conflict are key. Avoid capturing wild individuals for domestication.

description: A sleek, powerful and intelligent guardian breed known for alertness, loyalty and striking appearance.
health_considerations: Prone to dilated cardiomyopathy, von Willebrand disease and hip dysplasia. Sensitive to harsh training methods; need positive reinforcement.
key_health_tips: Schedule cardiac screening and genetic testing as recommended. Provide firm, consistent training and daily exercise to channel their drive.

description: A traditional British pack hound bred for stamina and scenting ability; friendly and driven.
health_considerations: Generally robust but can be prone to ear infections and orthopedic injuries from strenuous activity. Strong pack instincts require experienced handling.
key_health_tips: Provide sustained aerobic exercise and social outlets; secure containment is necessary due to strong scenting/roaming instincts. Regular ear care is important.

description: A graceful, elegant bird dog known for beautiful feathering, gentle nature and steady working style.

physical_traits.coat: Silky with feathering and speckled (belton) pattern

health_considerations: Prone to hip dysplasia, hypothyroidism and certain eye conditions. Their long coat requires regular maintenance to prevent mats.
key_health_tips: Provide regular grooming and exercise; watch body condition to avoid obesity. Have orthopedic and thyroid screening as recommended.

description: A versatile and friendly gun dog with boundless energy, strong nose and eagerness to please.

physical_traits.tail: Feathered, traditionally docked in some countries

health_considerations: Ear infections, hip dysplasia and progressive retinal atrophy can occur. Their high energy predisposes them to behavioral issues if bored.
key_health_tips: Provide daily strenuous exercise and mental challenges. Keep ears clean and groomed; discuss ophthalmic screening with your vet for breeding stock.

description: The smallest of the Swiss mountain dogs — sturdy, agile and devoted with a tricolor coat.

physical_traits.coat: Short to medium, dense and weatherproof

health_considerations: Can develop hip dysplasia and hereditary eye conditions. Their active nature means behavioral issues can appear if under-stimulated.
key_health_tips: Provide purposeful exercise and training; schedule orthopedic and eye exams for breeding lines. Keep weight controlled to protect joints.

description: Also called the American Eskimo Dog in domestic contexts — a lively, intelligent spitz-type with a thick white coat (note: name usage varies regionally).
health_considerations: Prone to dental problems, patellar luxation and hip dysplasia in larger types. Thick coat requires seasonal grooming to manage shedding.
key_health_tips: Provide regular brushing especially during heavy-shed seasons; maintain dental hygiene and monitor joints with moderate exercise.

description: A compact, muscular companion with a playful personality and distinctive bat-like ears.
health_considerations: Severely brachycephalic — at high risk for breathing difficulties, heatstroke, and complicated births (often C-section). Also prone to skin allergies and spinal issues.
key_health_tips: French Bulldogs need cool, climate-controlled environments in warm weather to avoid heatstroke. Plan for potential respiratory and reproductive veterinary care and keep activity moderate.

description: A versatile, intelligent working dog with strong protective instincts and high trainability — widely used in service work.
health_considerations: Prone to hip and elbow dysplasia, degenerative myelopathy and certain cardiac conditions. Early socialization and training are critical to channel their working instincts.
key_health_tips: Provide mental stimulation and structured training; maintain joint-supporting nutrition and schedule orthopedic screenings for breeding stock.

description: An all-purpose hunting dog: athletic, eager and versatile in the field with a short, dense coat.

physical_traits.tail: Docked traditionally; otherwise straight and strong

health_considerations: Prone to hip dysplasia, progressive retinal atrophy and certain bleeding disorders. High energy levels can lead to destructive behavior if not exercised.
key_health_tips: Provide daily endurance exercise and training; discuss ophthalmic and joint checks with a veterinarian. Use secure recall training when off-leash.

description: A powerful working breed with a dense wiry coat, intelligence and strong protective instincts.
health_considerations: May suffer from hip dysplasia, bloat, and certain hereditary eye disorders. Their dense coat requires regular grooming and stripping to maintain health.
key_health_tips: Provide structured daily work or training to satisfy mental needs. Maintain coat care and monitor for signs of bloat during heavy exercise after eating.

description: Friendly, intelligent and devoted dogs that make great family pets.
health_considerations: Prone to hip dysplasia and heart problems. Regular exercise is essential. Requires routine grooming to maintain coat health.
key_health_tips: Must have daily exercise (1-2 hours). Avoid overfeeding as they are prone to obesity. Regular vet checkups for hip and elbow evaluations.

description: A dignified, powerful setter with a black-and-tan coat and steady pointing abilities in the field.
health_considerations: Prone to hip dysplasia, progressive retinal atrophy and certain cancers. Their size and coat require consistent care and regular veterinary checks.
key_health_tips: Provide regular exercise and grooming; screen breeding dogs for hereditary eye and joint conditions. Monitor weight and overall condition.

description: A towering yet gentle giant known for noble appearance, friendly temperament and short coat.
health_considerations: High risk of bloat (GDV), cardiomyopathy and orthopedic problems. Short lifespan is common for giant breeds.
key_health_tips: Feed smaller, frequent meals and avoid vigorous exercise around feeding times to reduce bloat risk. Regular cardiac screening and joint care are essential.

description: A fluffy, majestic livestock guardian with a calm temperament and weather-resistant white coat.

physical_traits.tail: Long, heavily coated, carried low or curled

health_considerations: Prone to hip dysplasia, bloat and certain hereditary conditions; heavy coat can hide skin issues. Guardianship instincts may lead to independence.
key_health_tips: Provide secure containment and early socialization to manage guardian behaviors. Groom thoroughly to check skin and reduce matting; maintain joint health monitoring.

description: A big, rugged Swiss farm dog with tri-color markings, calm temperament and strong pulling ability.
health_considerations: Prone to hip dysplasia, bloat, and some cardiac issues. Large size can predispose to a shorter lifespan and orthopedic concerns.
key_health_tips: Manage weight carefully and avoid heavy exertion after feeding. Provide regular joint monitoring and controlled exercise to protect hips.

description: The long-coated variety of the Belgian Shepherd — elegant, alert and highly trainable with a striking black coat.

physical_traits.tail: Plumed and carried low to level

health_considerations: Can be affected by hip dysplasia, epilepsy and certain eye conditions. High-energy and strong work-drive require consistent outlets.
key_health_tips: Provide intensive mental and physical exercise daily. Groom long coat regularly and perform recommended health screenings for breeding stock.

description: A graceful Mediterranean sighthound with a lean build, large ears and notable speed and agility.

physical_traits.coat: Smooth or wire, short to medium

health_considerations: Sighthound sensitivities to some drugs/anesthesia and occasional orthopedic issues. Very high prey drive so off-leash recall can be unreliable.
key_health_tips: Exercise in secure areas and train reliable recall before off-leash. Use sighthound-appropriate anesthesia protocols and provide joint monitoring.

description: A flamboyant red setter known for friendly, outgoing personality and enthusiasm in the field.
health_considerations: Prone to hip dysplasia, progressive retinal atrophy and bloat. Long coat requires grooming to prevent mats and skin issues.
key_health_tips: Provide daily vigorous exercise and grooming. Discuss orthopedic and ocular screening for breeding stock and limit heavy meals before intense activity.

description: A fiery, wiry-coated terrier with a bold, loyal temperament and history as a working farm dog.
health_considerations: Generally healthy but can show hip dysplasia and certain skin conditions. Active working heritage demands outlets for energy.
key_health_tips: Provide regular exercise and grooming to protect coat. Early socialization and training reduce over-protective tendencies.

description: A curly-coated, water-loving spaniel with a playful, intelligent nature and distinctive topknot and rat-like tail.
health_considerations: May develop hip dysplasia and hypothyroidism; ear and skin infections can occur under heavy curl. Grooming prevents matting and skin problems.
key_health_tips: Regular grooming to prevent mats and skin issues; check ears after swimming. Provide active water exercise and monitor thyroid function as advised.

description: A very large, ancient sighthound originally bred to hunt wolves — noble, calm and gentle despite imposing size.
health_considerations: Short lifespan for large breeds; susceptible to bloat, cardiomyopathy and bone cancers. Joint issues are common due to rapid growth.
key_health_tips: Manage diet during growth to avoid rapid weight gain; discuss orthopedic and cardiac screening with your vet. Provide soft bedding and careful handling due to size.

description: A miniature sighthound with an elegant, slender build, affectionate nature and impressive speed.
health_considerations: Prone to fractures due to very fine bone structure, dental issues and temperature sensitivity. Separation anxiety can occur in very attached individuals.
key_health_tips: Provide warm clothing in cold weather and handle gently to avoid bone injuries. Supervise around children and use soft bedding to protect delicate bones.

description: A graceful toy companion with an aristocratic air, known for catlike manners and a silky coat.
health_considerations: Brachycephalic traits can contribute to breathing and eye issues; dental crowding is common. Coat care needed to prevent tangles and skin problems.
key_health_tips: Protect from heat and avoid heavy exertion in warm weather. Maintain dental hygiene and groom coat regularly to prevent mats.

description: A friendly, fox-faced spitz with a plush double coat and expressive markings; excellent companion and watchdog.

physical_traits.coat: Thick double coat with plush ruff
physical_traits.tail: Curled and heavily plumed over back

health_considerations: Can be prone to hip dysplasia, patellar luxation and certain autoimmune conditions. Heavy coat requires seasonal grooming to manage shedding and skin checks.
key_health_tips: Commit to frequent brushing, especially during heavy-shed seasons. Provide mental stimulation and moderate daily exercise; monitor joints as they age.

description: A highly energetic and intelligent herding dog bred for endurance and independent stockwork.

physical_traits.coat: Short to medium, dense and weather-resistant
physical_traits.tail: Moderate length, carried low to level

health_considerations: Generally healthy but can develop hip dysplasia, progressive retinal atrophy, and certain endocrine conditions. Their high activity level can reveal orthopedic weaknesses if overworked.
key_health_tips: Require very active daily work or sport (1–2+ hours) to prevent boredom and destructive behavior. Screen breeding stock for eye disorders and maintain lean condition to protect joints.

description: A versatile Irish terrier with a soft, blue-grey coat and a bold, loyal personality.
health_considerations: Can be prone to skin conditions, hip dysplasia and some eye disorders. Grooming-related skin issues may appear if coat care is neglected.
key_health_tips: Regular professional grooming is essential to keep the coat healthy and to check skin. Monitor hips in active dogs and maintain regular vet checks for skin and eye health.

description: A distinctive livestock guardian known for its heavy, corded coat and protective instincts.

physical_traits.ears: Medium, pendant, often hidden in cords
physical_traits.tail: Set high, carried low when relaxed

health_considerations: Prone to hip dysplasia and can be vulnerable to skin infections under heavy cords if not properly maintained. Their large size increases orthopedic risks.
key_health_tips: Commit to extensive grooming (regular separation/cleaning of cords) to prevent mats and skin problems. Provide secure fencing and socialization to manage guardian behaviors.

description: A large, white Hungarian livestock guardian: brave, loyal and independent with a dense weather-resistant coat.
health_considerations: Susceptible to hip dysplasia, bloat and certain autoimmune conditions; heavy coat can hide skin problems. Large size shortens average lifespan.
key_health_tips: Provide secure containment and early socialization; maintain regular orthopedic screening. Groom seasonally and inspect skin under the coat frequently.

description: A friendly, intelligent and versatile sporting dog prized as a family companion and working partner.
health_considerations: Prone to obesity, hip and elbow dysplasia, and progressive retinal atrophy in some lines. Obesity worsens joint disease and shortens lifespan.
key_health_tips: Measure food to avoid weight gain and provide daily vigorous exercise. Screen breeding stock for hips and eyes and check thyroid function as advised.

description: A bold, compact terrier from England’s Lake District with a wiry coat and lively temperament.

physical_traits.coat: Hard, wiry topcoat with soft undercoat

health_considerations: Generally healthy but can experience eye conditions and patellar luxation; skin allergies are possible. Small size makes dental care important.
key_health_tips: Provide daily play/exercise to satisfy terrier energy and regular dental cleanings. Keep coat hand-stripped or properly trimmed to retain texture and inspect skin.

description: A large, lion-like companion with a flowing coat and gentle, family-friendly temperament.

physical_traits.coat: Long, dense double coat with mane-like ruff

health_considerations: High incidence of hip dysplasia, osteosarcoma and other cancers; large size shortens average lifespan. Cardiac issues may also occur.
key_health_tips: Manage growth and calories during puppyhood to limit orthopedic stress and discuss cancer screening with your veterinarian. Provide soft bedding and controlled exercise.

description: An ancient Tibetan companion with a long, flowing coat and independent, loyal personality.
health_considerations: Prone to progressive retinal atrophy, hip dysplasia and patellar luxation in some lines. Long coat requires dedication to grooming and skin checks.
key_health_tips: Keep up routine grooming to prevent mats and skin infections; schedule ophthalmic checks and monitor hips. Use positive, patient training methods due to independent nature.

description: A powerful Arctic sled dog with a thick double coat, great strength and friendly disposition.
health_considerations: Prone to hip dysplasia, inherited polyneuropathy in some lines, and obesity if under-exercised. Thick coat predisposes them to heat intolerance.
key_health_tips: Avoid hot climates and provide cool resting areas; ensure heavy, daily exercise and mental work. Keep weight controlled and screen breeding stock for hereditary neurologic issues.

description: An intense, highly trainable herding/working dog widely used in police and military roles for its drive and focus.

physical_traits.coat: Short, dense and fawn with black overlay

health_considerations: Prone to hip dysplasia, progressive retinal atrophy and certain skin allergies. High-drive dogs may develop behavioral problems if unstimulated.
key_health_tips: Provide intensive daily physical and mental work (sports, tasks) and early structured training. Screen hips and eyes for breeding stock and maintain lean condition.

description: A gentle, affectionate toy breed with a long, silky white coat and big personality in a tiny package.
health_considerations: Susceptible to dental disease, luxating patella and tracheal collapse in some cases. Thin bone structure requires careful handling.
key_health_tips: Daily dental care and regular professional cleanings help prevent periodontal disease. Handle gently, supervise with young children, and groom frequently to avoid mats.

description: An ancient Mexican hairless breed (also available coated) noted for calm temperament and warm skin.

physical_traits.coat: Hairless or coated varieties; skin smooth

health_considerations: Hairless varieties require skin care to prevent sunburn and dryness; all varieties should be monitored for dental issues. Some lines may develop allergies.
key_health_tips: Protect hairless dogs from sun exposure with sunscreen or clothing and moisturize skin as needed. Maintain dental hygiene and regular skin inspections to catch irritation early.

description: A lively, fearless little companion often called the 'King of Toys' for its bold demeanor and spirited gait.
health_considerations: Prone to patellar luxation and leg fractures due to small size; dental disease is common. Some lines are sensitive to anesthesia.
key_health_tips: Supervise with children to avoid injury; use harnesses rather than collars to protect the trachea. Keep teeth brushed and ensure safe surfaces to prevent slips and fractures.

description: A smart, elegant dog with a curly coat; the miniature poodle is energetic, trainable and adaptable to many homes.
health_considerations: May develop hip dysplasia, eye problems and progressive kidney disease in some lines; coat requires regular maintenance. Dental disease is a common small-breed issue.
key_health_tips: Commit to regular clipping/maintenance to prevent mats and skin problems. Provide mental enrichment and regular dental care; screen breeding stock for hereditary conditions.

description: A spirited, alert terrier with a distinctive beard and wiry coat; friendly yet protective of family.

physical_traits.ears: Small, folded or erect if cropped
physical_traits.coat: Hard, wiry outer coat with soft undercoat

health_considerations: Prone to pancreatitis, bladder stones and certain eye conditions; some lines experience skin allergies. Dental care is important for small breeds.
key_health_tips: Feed a consistent, high-quality diet and avoid table scraps to reduce pancreatitis risk. Maintain grooming (hand stripping/clipping) and schedule routine dental cleanings.

description: A gentle, massive water dog famed for strength, a sweet temperament and remarkable swimming ability.
health_considerations: High risk of hip dysplasia, subvalvular aortic stenosis and cystinuria in some lines; short lifespan relative to smaller breeds. Heavy coat can mask skin issues.
key_health_tips: Provide joint-supporting nutrition and avoid rapid growth in puppies. Groom regularly, check skin beneath coat, and schedule cardiac screenings as advised.

description: A compact, hardy terrier with a friendly disposition and a wiry, weatherproof coat.
health_considerations: Generally robust but can have patellar luxation and eye problems; dental care is important. As terriers, they can be tenacious and need training.
key_health_tips: Provide consistent training and daily play to channel terrier energy. Keep up with dental hygiene and basic grooming to maintain coat health.

description: A rugged Scandinavian spitz with strong hunting instincts, a dense coat and friendly temperament.
health_considerations: Prone to hip dysplasia and certain eye conditions; can develop obesity if not exercised. Thick coat can lead to heavy shedding.
key_health_tips: Provide daily exercise and brushing during heavy-shed seasons. Monitor weight and perform orthopedic screening for breeding stock.

description: A lively, compact terrier with a friendly nature and sturdy build, excellent for active families.
health_considerations: May develop dental issues and patellar luxation; generally hardy. Regular ear and skin checks help avoid common minor problems.
key_health_tips: Keep active with daily walks and play; perform routine dental care. Maintain grooming to prevent mats and check joints periodically.

description: A shaggy, amiable herding breed with a profuse coat and playful, gentle temperament.

physical_traits.ears: Small to medium, carried close to head
physical_traits.tail: Historically docked; otherwise long and well-feathered

health_considerations: Prone to hip dysplasia, hypothyroidism and eye conditions; heavy coat can hide skin infections. Grooming demands are significant.
key_health_tips: Commit to daily grooming and regular professional clipping to prevent mats and skin problems. Maintain moderate exercise to keep joints healthy.

description: A rare, rough-coated scent hound with webbed feet and a friendly, boisterous personality bred for otter hunting.
health_considerations: Prone to hip dysplasia, ear infections and bloat; thick coat requires attention to skin health. Otterhounds have high exercise needs.
key_health_tips: Provide secure, prolonged exercise and routine ear cleaning. Monitor for signs of bloat and maintain grooming to prevent matting and skin infections.

description: A graceful toy breed with distinctive butterfly-like ears, lively disposition and high intelligence.

physical_traits.coat: Long, silky and single/double depending on lines

health_considerations: May develop luxating patella, dental disease and progressive retinal atrophy in some lines. Small size increases risk of injury from falls.
key_health_tips: Provide careful handling and dental care; engage in mental activities to channel intelligence. Keep warm in cold weather and supervise around larger animals/children.

description: An ancient toy companion from China with a flattened face, flowing coat and independent temperament.
health_considerations: Severely brachycephalic and prone to breathing difficulties, eye problems and heat intolerance. Spinal issues and intervertebral disc disease can occur.
key_health_tips: Avoid hot climates and strenuous activity; monitor for respiratory distress. Keep eyes clean, maintain dental hygiene and be prepared for potential anesthesia risks.

description: A cheerful, energetic herding dog with short legs, foxlike face and strong herding instincts.
health_considerations: High risk of intervertebral disc disease due to long back and short legs; hip dysplasia and obesity are common. Their herding drive can lead to nipping behaviors if untrained.
key_health_tips: Limit jumping and stair use to protect the spine; keep weight lean and provide core-strengthening activities. Early training and socialization curb unwanted herding behaviors.

description: A tiny, vivacious spitz with a fluffy double coat and confident, alert personality.

physical_traits.coat: Thick double coat with abundant ruff

health_considerations: Prone to dental disease, luxating patella and tracheal collapse; coat-related skin issues can occur. Fragile bone structure increases risk of injury.
key_health_tips: Maintain rigorous dental care and avoid rough handling; groom frequently to prevent mats and skin problems. Use harnesses rather than collars to protect the airway.

description: A compact, affectionate companion with a flat face, large eyes and a playful, clownish demeanor.
health_considerations: Brachycephalic — prone to breathing difficulties, heatstroke and eye injuries; obesity exacerbates all issues. Some dogs have spinal or skin problems.
key_health_tips: Keep pugs in cool environments and avoid strenuous exercise in heat. Control diet to prevent obesity and protect eyes from trauma; consult vet about breathing concerns.

description: A striking red-colored scent hound bred for endurance and treeing game, known for a sweet, steady temperament.
health_considerations: Ear infections and hip dysplasia can occur; their strong scent drive can lead to roaming if off-leash. Generally robust but active.
key_health_tips: Secure containment and leash control are essential due to tracking instincts. Clean ears regularly and provide daily aerobic exercise to maintain condition.

description: A muscular African breed originally used to track and bay large game; dignified, independent and loyal.
health_considerations: Can develop hip dysplasia and dermoid sinus in some lines; generally tolerant of heat but require adequate shade and water. Strong prey drive may lead to chasing.
key_health_tips: Provide secure containment and early socialization; screen breeding stock for dermoid sinus. Maintain lean condition and avoid excessive breeding from affected lines.

description: A powerful, confident working breed with a protective nature and deep loyalty to its family.

physical_traits.tail: Traditionally docked; otherwise strong and tapering

health_considerations: Prone to hip and elbow dysplasia, osteosarcoma and certain heart conditions. Weight management is critical to reduce joint stress.
key_health_tips: Provide structured training and socialization; maintain lean body weight and regular orthopedic screening. Consult veterinarian for cardiac checks when indicated.

description: A massive, affectionate rescue and working dog renowned for strength, calm temperament and thick coat.

physical_traits.coat: Short or long double coat, dense

health_considerations: High risk of bloat, hip dysplasia and osteosarcoma; many giant-breed health issues shorten life expectancy. Heavy coats may hide skin conditions.
key_health_tips: Feed smaller, frequent meals and avoid vigorous activity around mealtimes to reduce bloat risk. Provide joint-supporting nutrition and regular veterinary orthopedic checks.

description: An elegant sighthound of ancient lineage prized for speed, endurance and gentle demeanor.
health_considerations: Sighthound sensitivity to certain anesthetics, occasional hip dysplasia and some cardiac concerns. Thin body makes them prone to cold and injury.
key_health_tips: Use sighthound-appropriate anesthesia protocols, exercise in secure areas to satisfy chase drives, and provide warm bedding in cool climates. Monitor joints and cardiac health.

description: A smiling, fluffy arctic working dog with a white double coat, friendly nature and strong endurance.
health_considerations: Prone to hip dysplasia, progressive retinal atrophy and diabetes in some lines. Heavy shedding and coat-related skin issues are common.
key_health_tips: Brush frequently and manage seasonal shedding; provide daily exercise and monitor weight. Screen breeding stock for hips and eye conditions.

description: A small Belgian spitz historically used as a barge dog — curious, nimble and alert with a thick black coat.

physical_traits.tail: Traditionally docked; otherwise short and carried high

health_considerations: May be prone to luxating patella, Legg-Calvé-Perthes in some lines and eye problems. Thick coat means seasonal shedding and grooming needs.
key_health_tips: Provide mental stimulation and daily activity to prevent boredom. Brush seasonally and perform routine joint and eye checks as recommended.

description: A dignified, independent terrier with a distinctive beard and wiry coat, known for loyalty and stubborn streaks.

physical_traits.coat: Hard, wiry outer coat with soft undercoat

health_considerations: Prone to von Willebrand disease (bleeding disorder), hypothyroidism and certain cancers. Some lines may develop skin and eye conditions.
key_health_tips: Screen for inherited bleeding disorders before invasive procedures and in breeding stock. Maintain regular vet checks and consistent grooming to manage coat health.

description: A tall, gentle sighthound bred for coursing deer — dignified, calm and swift.
health_considerations: Short lifespan for size and prone to bloat, cardiomyopathy and bone cancers. Sighthound sensitivity to anesthesia is also a factor.
key_health_tips: Use sighthound-appropriate anesthesia protocols, feed smaller meals to reduce bloat risk and provide soft bedding. Avoid rapid growth in puppies to protect bones.

description: A robust, short-legged terrier with a bold personality and characteristic white, wiry coat.
health_considerations: Can develop deafness, eye conditions and skin allergies; dental issues are possible. As a smaller terrier, dental hygiene is important.
key_health_tips: Keep ears and eyes inspected regularly and maintain dental care. Provide training to manage stubborn tendencies and regular grooming to maintain coat.

description: A small agile herding dog with a striking mane, intelligent nature and eager-to-please temperament.

physical_traits.coat: Long double coat with abundant mane

health_considerations: Prone to Collie eye anomaly, progressive retinal atrophy and hypothyroidism; they can also suffer from hip dysplasia in some lines. High intelligence can lead to anxiety without tasks.
key_health_tips: Provide mental stimulation (training, agility) and routine ophthalmic screening. Maintain grooming to prevent mats and monitor weight for joint health.

description: A sweet, sturdy toy dog with a long flowing coat and friendly, companion-oriented nature.

physical_traits.tail: Curled over back and heavily plumed

health_considerations: Brachycephalic — prone to breathing problems, eye issues and dental crowding. Skin fold infections and ear issues can occur under a heavy coat.
key_health_tips: Avoid overheating and strenuous exercise in hot weather; perform routine dental and eye care. Keep coat groomed and inspect skin folds to prevent infection.

description: A hardy, energetic sled dog with striking eyes, a thick double coat and friendly, pack-oriented nature.

physical_traits.tail: Bushy, carried over back in cold

health_considerations: Prone to hip dysplasia, eye disorders (cataracts, PRA) and certain skin conditions; not well-suited to hot climates due to thick coat. High prey drive and escape tendencies are common.
key_health_tips: Avoid hot environments and provide cool resting areas; exercise daily with secure containment. Groom heavily during shedding seasons and screen breeding stock for eye disorders.

description: A small, elegant terrier with a long, silky coat and lively, affectionate temperament.
health_considerations: May suffer from luxating patella, eye conditions and dental disease; coat requires regular care to prevent mats. Small size increases injury risk.
key_health_tips: Brush daily and trim to prevent tangles; perform routine dental care and supervise interactions with larger animals. Provide gentle, consistent training and exercise.

description: A sturdy, muscular terrier known for courage, affection toward family and strong jaw combined with a playful nature.
health_considerations: Can suffer from hip dysplasia, skin allergies and certain cardiac issues. Responsible breeding has reduced some inherited problems but health screening remains important.
key_health_tips: Provide early socialization and training; maintain lean body condition and check skin for allergies regularly. Screen breeding stock for hips and cardiac conditions.

description: A highly intelligent, elegant working and companion dog with a curly, hypoallergenic coat and strong trainability.
health_considerations: May develop hip dysplasia, Addison’s disease and certain eye conditions; coat requires regular clipping to prevent mats. Some lines show a predisposition to bloat.
key_health_tips: Commit to regular grooming and professional clipping; provide mental stimulation and exercise. Screen breeding stock for endocrine and orthopedic conditions.

description: A robust, versatile working terrier with a bristly coat, keen intelligence and strong protective instincts.

physical_traits.ears: Medium, folded or erect if cropped
physical_traits.coat: Harsh, wiry outer coat with dense undercoat

health_considerations: Can experience hip dysplasia, bladder stones and certain eye disorders. Coat maintenance and dental health are routine concerns.
key_health_tips: Keep active with daily exercise and mental tasks to prevent boredom. Maintain grooming (hand stripping/clipping) and monitor urinary health.

description: A low-slung spaniel with a rich golden liver coat, steady working style and calm demeanor.

physical_traits.coat: Thick, short to medium with feathering

health_considerations: Prone to ear infections, hip dysplasia and obesity due to low activity level. Their dense coat requires grooming to prevent mats.
key_health_tips: Encourage regular moderate exercise to maintain weight, clean ears to prevent infections and groom regularly. Monitor mobility for signs of joint issues.

description: A large, imposing guardian with a dense mane-like coat and independent temperament developed to protect flocks in the Himalayas.

physical_traits.coat: Thick double coat, heavy around neck

health_considerations: Prone to hip dysplasia, hypothyroidism and certain autoimmune conditions; large size shortens lifespan. Heavy coat predisposes to heat sensitivity in warm climates.
key_health_tips: Provide secure, spacious containment and early socialization; avoid hot climates and ensure cool resting areas. Schedule orthopedic and thyroid screening as advised.

description: A sturdy Tibetan companion with a profuse, profuse double coat and affectionate, people-oriented nature.
health_considerations: May develop hip dysplasia, progressive retinal atrophy and luxating patella in some lines. Coat requires consistent grooming to avoid mats and skin problems.
key_health_tips: Keep up with regular brushing and occasional professional grooming; screen breeding stock for hip and eye conditions. Provide moderate daily exercise and training.

description: A clever and elegant tiny poodle variety prized for companionship, hypoallergenic coat and high trainability.
health_considerations: Susceptible to dental disease, luxating patella and certain genetic disorders; coat requires regular maintenance. Fragile bone structure demands careful handling.
key_health_tips: Brush teeth daily and provide appropriate chew items; maintain frequent grooming appointments. Supervise with young children and avoid rough play that risks fractures.

description: A diminutive terrier-type companion (often English Toy Terrier) with an alert, spirited personality and sleek coat.
health_considerations: May develop dental disease, patellar luxation and respiratory sensitivity; small size increases injury risk. Some lines have cardiac concerns.
key_health_tips: Use harnesses rather than collars, maintain dental hygiene and supervise around large dogs/children. Keep warm in cold weather and provide secure environments.

description: A sleek Hungarian pointing dog with high energy, close human bonding and excellent versatility in fieldwork.
health_considerations: Can be prone to hip dysplasia, epilepsy and certain skin allergies; separation anxiety can occur if left alone long periods. High exercise needs are typical.
key_health_tips: Provide daily vigorous exercise and strong handler interaction to prevent anxiety-related behaviors. Screen breeding stock for hips and monitor for epilepsy where prevalent.

description: A fast, agile scent hound with strong treeing instincts, used for tracking and cornering game.

physical_traits.coat: Short, dense and smooth with tricolor pattern
physical_traits.tail: Long and carried high when working

health_considerations: Ear infections, hip dysplasia and obesity can be issues; strong scent drive means they may roam if not contained. Generally hardy with active lifestyle needs.
key_health_tips: Ensure secure fencing and leash control; clean ears regularly and provide sustained aerobic exercise. Control feeding to avoid obesity and monitor joints.

description: A sleek, silver-grey pointing dog with high energy, strong prey drive and close bonds with owners.

physical_traits.tail: Usually docked; otherwise straight and strong

health_considerations: Prone to hip dysplasia, bloat and certain cancers; separation anxiety is common in highly bonded individuals. High exercise requirements must be met.
key_health_tips: Provide daily vigorous exercise and mental tasks; feed smaller meals and avoid heavy activity around mealtimes to reduce bloat risk. Consider training to manage separation anxiety.

description: A devoted, energetic gundog with red-and-white coloring, friendly temperament and strong retrieving instincts.
health_considerations: May develop hip dysplasia, ear infections and certain immune-related conditions; dense coat requires grooming. Active working needs must be met to avoid behavioral issues.
key_health_tips: Provide daily exercise and fieldwork where possible; clean ears after water exposure and groom regularly. Keep weight appropriate and perform orthopedic screening as needed.

description: A bold, friendly terrier with a bright white coat, lively personality and sturdy build.

physical_traits.coat: Double coat, harsh outer and soft undercoat

health_considerations: Prone to skin allergies, atopic dermatitis and luxating patella; dental disease is also a concern. Regular grooming and skin monitoring are necessary.
key_health_tips: Use hypoallergenic diets or vet guidance for chronic skin issues and groom frequently. Keep up dental care and provide regular exercise to maintain healthy weight.

description: A graceful, fast sighthound with slender build, gentle temperament and impressive short-distance speed.
health_considerations: Sighthound sensitivities to anesthesia and occasional cardiac or orthopedic issues; thin body increases susceptibility to cold. Generally sound but needs safe containment due to chase drive.
key_health_tips: Provide sighthound-safe anesthesia protocols, warm bedding and secure exercise areas. Monitor for cardiac issues and avoid rough play that risks fractures.

description: A tiny, spirited toy terrier with a long silky coat and bold, affectionate personality.

physical_traits.tail: Often docked; otherwise small and carried high

health_considerations: Prone to dental disease, hypoglycemia in puppies and luxating patella; fragile bones increase injury risk. Coat requires substantial grooming if kept long.
key_health_tips: Brush teeth daily and schedule regular dental cleanings; supervise play to avoid fractures. Maintain grooming and use harnesses to protect trachea while walking.

description: A muscular scent hound with a glossy black-and-tan coat, bred for endurance and tracking game at night.

physical_traits.coat: Short, dense and glossy black with tan markings
physical_traits.tail: Long and carried high when working

health_considerations: Can develop ear infections, obesity and hip dysplasia; strong scent drive may lead to roaming. Generally hardy when exercised regularly.
key_health_tips: Provide secure containment, routine ear care and sustained exercise to maintain condition. Measure food to prevent obesity which exacerbates joint issues.

description: A hardy, water-loving retriever with a distinctive tight, curly coat and independent working style.
health_considerations: Prone to hip dysplasia, bloat and sometimes cardiac issues; coat requires attention after water work to prevent skin problems. Independent nature can mask health signs.
key_health_tips: Rinse and dry thoroughly after water activities and perform routine coat/skin checks. Provide steady exercise and consider smaller meals to reduce bloat risk.

description: A sunny, energetic retriever with a shiny black or liver coat and exuberant, people-oriented personality.
health_considerations: Relatively high incidence of certain cancers and hip dysplasia; they are active and require lots of exercise. Coat care is moderate.
key_health_tips: Provide vigorous daily exercise and mental tasks; practice good grooming and monitor for early signs of cancer. Maintain joint health with appropriate nutrition and screening.

description: A friendly, single-coated terrier with a soft, silky wheaten coat and lively, affectionate temperament.

physical_traits.coat: Soft, silky, single coat with wave

health_considerations: Prone to protein-losing nephropathy and enteropathy in some lines, as well as hip dysplasia and allergies. Coat requires consistent maintenance to avoid mats.
key_health_tips: Ask breeders about health clearances for PLN/PLE and maintain regular vet screening for protein loss. Groom frequently and provide balanced nutrition to support skin and kidneys.

description: A classic English terrier with a dense wiry coat, lively character and history as a bold ratter and companion.
health_considerations: May develop lens luxation, deafness and certain skin allergies; dental care is important for small breeds. High energy can lead to destructive behaviors if unstimulated.
key_health_tips: Provide daily vigorous activity and consistent training; groom and hand-strip or clip to maintain coat health. Schedule regular dental and ophthalmologic checks as recommended.
